meanings.definition: The revival or reappearance of a disease or symptoms.
meanings.sent1: The recrudescence of the flu led to many people getting sick again.
meanings.sent2: The doctor warned the patient about the recrudescence of the virus after feeling better.
meanings.sent3: The recrudescence of allergies during springtime made everyone sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The recrudescence of the virus spread like wildfire in the community.
meanings.sent5: The sudden recrudescence of the illness caught everyone by surprise.

meanings.definition: A renewed outbreak or recurrence of something undesirable.
meanings.sent1: The recrudescence of arguments between siblings caused tension in the house.
meanings.sent2: The recrudescence of bad habits hindered his progress in achieving his goals.
meanings.sent3: The recrudescence of bad luck seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: The recrudescence of rumors spread quickly through the small town.
meanings.sent5: The sudden recrudescence of problems overwhelmed him.

meanings.definition: The recurrence of violence or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The recrudescence of fights in the neighborhood worried the residents.
meanings.sent2: The recrudescence of tensions between the two countries raised concerns about war.
meanings.sent3: The recrudescence of arguments at the family dinner table was both amusing and chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The recrudescence of hostility in the workplace created a toxic environment.
meanings.sent5: The sudden recrudescence of aggression left everyone on edge.
